Faithful Stewardship

Managing God's Resources with Integrity

Introduction

Stewardship is not just about money—it's a lifestyle of faithful management of everything God entrusts to us. From our time and talents to our finances and possessions, God calls us to be wise stewards who honor Him in all things.

1. Everything Belongs to God

True stewardship begins with acknowledging that nothing we have is truly ours—it all belongs to God.

"The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith the Lord of hosts." — Haggai 2:8
"Moreover it is required in stewards, that a man be found faithful." — 1 Corinthians 4:2

2. Faithful in the Little Things

God values how we manage even the smallest of His blessings. He tests our faithfulness in little before entrusting us with more.

"He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much." — Luke 16:10
"God tests men by committing to them temporal possessions, that their use may show whether He can trust them with eternal riches." — Christ’s Object Lessons, p. 325

3. Giving Reflects Our Trust

Returning tithes and offerings is a tangible expression of our trust in God's provision and our loyalty to His cause.

"Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse... and prove me now herewith, saith the Lord of hosts." — Malachi 3:10
"The Lord calls for every talent of means to be invested in His work. Self-denial and sacrifice must be practiced." — Testimonies for the Church, Vol. 9, p. 50

4. Stewardship Extends Beyond Money

Time, health, influence, and spiritual gifts are also areas where faithful stewardship is required.

"Our time belongs to God. Every moment is His, and we are under the most solemn obligation to improve it to His glory." — Christ’s Object Lessons, p. 342

Conclusion

Faithful stewardship is a practical expression of our relationship with God. It reveals our priorities and our trust in Him. May we be found faithful stewards, wisely managing the Master's goods until He returns.
